data.body:
User can configure how agent models/types/versions are selected per workflow step.  For example, you can say you want 50% of impl steps to be Claude Sonnet 4.6, 25% to be Claude Opus 4.6, 25% to be OpenAI Codex 5.3.

the value of this is multi-fold:

1) Distribute work to manage account quotas
2) Track performance - which guys are faster
3) Failover - we can have circuit breaks that capture when agents return errors or rate limits, and move on to the next agent type until a recovery is detected.
data.title: New Feature: Agent Pools
